article.headline: Lehigh 64, Holy Cross 63
article.story: BETHLEHEM, Pa. (AP) -- Junior Jose Olivero hit a running layup with 4.3 seconds left and Lehigh rallied to a 64-63 victory over Holy Cross on Saturday night. A 3-point shot by Holy Cross' Colin Cunningham missed the mark as time expired. Olivero finished with 29 points and hit the fourth game-winning shot of his career. He shot 10-for-16 and was perfect in seven attempts from the free-throw line. Kyle Neptune finished with 10 points, four rebounds, and three assists for the Mountain Hawks (13-9, 6-1 Patriot League). Kevin Hamilton led Holy Cross (11-10, 4-2) with 20 points, and Tim Clifford added 19 points on 8-for-13 shooting. Holy Cross led by 14 points late in the first half before Lehigh used a 7-2 run to close within 37-28 at the break. Lehigh trailed by 10 points with 10:46 remaining. But Neptune capped an 8-0 run with a pair of free throws to get the Mountain Hawks within 53-51 with 6:12 left. Olivero hit two free throws with 16 seconds left to pull Lehigh within two points. On the ensuing possession, White made a steal near midcourt. After a timeout, Olivero drove down the right side of the lane and scored the winning basket on a layup.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
